name: bamboo
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U or C ] a tall tropical grass with hard, hollow stems: There are shady tunnels of colossal bamboo (especially welcome in the blazing summers). In her garden she has bamboos, wonderful rare tree ferns, palm trees and bananas.
GYRO PHOTOGRAPHY/amanaimagesRF//GettyImages
[ U or C ] the stems of this plant, used to make canes (= long sticks), buildings, furniture, and other items, or a single stem of the plant: Use bamboo canes to support tomato plants. The tropical-style lobby has potted palms and bamboo furniture. The children carried long bamboos to chase away the chickens.
The Real Tokyo Life/Moment/GettyImages
[ U ] the fibres (= thread-like parts) of the plant, made into a soft cloth: Her clothing is made of bamboo and organic cotton.
More examplesFewer examplesThe entrance lounge includes 12-foot bamboos and wall planters overflowing with orchids.The picture shows a red panda chewing on bamboo leaves at the Sacramento Zoo.In these villages houses are typically made of bamboo lashed together with thin strips of wood.Men aim bamboo spears tipped with iron to catch snappers, sea perch, cod and squid.The company is trying to enhance bamboo fabric by making it resistant to the sun's ultraviolet rays and to odor-causing microbes.
